intro: Pentace tonkinensis, commonly known as the Tonkin pentace, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its attractive foliage and flowers.
